byline.original: By JOSH KRON and JEFFREY GETTLEMAN
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Foreign military forces join offensive against Shabab militant group in Somalia as Kenyan troops advance toward the rebel stronghold of Kismayu from two different directions; American officials say that neither United States military nor the Central Intelligence Agency has carried out airstrikes in Somalia in recent days.
snippet: Foreign military forces have joined the offensive against the Shabab militant group in Somalia as Kenyan troops advanced toward a rebel stronghold.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: Foreign military forces have joined the offensive against the Shabab militant group in Somalia as Kenyan troops advanced toward a rebel stronghold.

headline.main: Kenya Says Western Nations Join Fight in Somalia, as U.S. Denies Role
headline.print_headline: Kenya Says Western Nations Join Fight in Somalia, as U.S. Denies Role
headline.seo: Kenya Says Western Nations Have Joined Somalia Fight
